articles.headline: This Is the Most Lucrative Moment in History to Catch Bass
articles.snippet: A rivalry between two tournament fishing circuits has slapped the industry like a 10-pound largemouth to the face.
articles.abstract: A rivalry between two tournament fishing circuits has slapped the industry like a 10-pound largemouth to the face.
articles.lead_paragraph: One Friday morning in August, even before the sun had risen over the St. Lawrence River, the docks in Waddington, N.Y., were aglow. Some of the artificial light came from a flotilla of sleek boats that drifted around the marina, kitted out with luminous fish-finder devices. The rest emanated from smartphones and video cameras, as dozens of professional anglers recorded social-media clips ahead of the last competition of the regular season.

articles.headline: Sears’s Edward Lampert Was a Wizard. Now He’s Coming to Terms With Failure.
articles.snippet: Sears went bankrupt under the financier’s leadership. For the first time since the bankruptcy, Mr. Lampert speaks publicly about how he got it wrong.
articles.abstract: Sears went bankrupt under the financier’s leadership. For the first time since the bankruptcy, Mr. Lampert speaks publicly about how he got it wrong.
articles.lead_paragraph: By age 25, Edward S. Lampert was already a Wall Street wunderkind, celebrated for his intellect, ambition and prodigious work ethic. The famed investor Richard Rainwater, the billionaire Hollywood mogul David Geffen, and Michael Dell and Thomas J. Tisch were among the prominent backers who gave him more than $200 million in start-up capital.

articles.headline: Amazon HQ2 Watch: Northern Virginia Checks the Most Boxes
articles.snippet: Amazon won’t say a word about where it plans to put its much-hyped second headquarters. But there is a growing consensus that it will go across the river from Washington.
articles.abstract: Amazon won’t say a word about where it plans to put its much-hyped second headquarters. But there is a growing consensus that it will go across the river from Washington.
articles.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — Amazon won’t say a word about where it plans to put its much-hyped second headquarters. Officials in the 20 cities and regions named as finalists say that they don’t know anything — and that even if they did, they wouldn’t share it publicly.

articles.headline: Saudis May Blame Intelligence Official for Killing Jamal Khashoggi
articles.snippet: Saudi rulers are considering blaming a deputy intelligence director who is close to Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.
articles.abstract: Saudi rulers are considering blaming a deputy intelligence director who is close to Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL — The rulers of Saudi Arabia are considering blaming a top intelligence official close to Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman for the killing of Jamal Khashoggi, three people with knowledge of the Saudi plans said Thursday.
articles.byline: By David D. Kirkpatrick and Ben Hubbard

articles.headline: In Shift on Khashoggi Killing, Trump Edges Closer to Acknowledging a Saudi Role
articles.snippet: But the president stopped short of saying the Saudi crown prince, Mohammed bin Salman, was responsible for Mr. Khashoggi’s death.
articles.abstract: But the president stopped short of saying the Saudi crown prince, Mohammed bin Salman, was responsible for Mr. Khashoggi’s death.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump said on Thursday that he believes the Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi is dead, and he expressed confidence in intelligence reports from multiple sources that strongly suggest a high-level Saudi role in Mr. Khashoggi’s assassination.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Mark Landler, Michael S. Schmidt and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Justice Department Investigates Pennsylvania Dioceses Accused of Sex Abuse Cover-Up
articles.snippet: Dioceses across the state said Thursday that they had received federal grand jury subpoenas.
articles.abstract: Dioceses across the state said Thursday that they had received federal grand jury subpoenas.
articles.lead_paragraph: ERIE, Pa. — The Justice Department has opened an investigation into Roman Catholic dioceses in Pennsylvania accused of covering up sex abuse for decades, a significant escalation in scrutiny of the church.
articles.byline: By Campbell Robertson and Elizabeth Dias

articles.headline: In 2020, Democrats Expect a Female Front-Runner. Or Three.
articles.snippet: “It’s not going to be just one woman running,” said Kirsten Gillibrand, one of three senators who positioned themselves this week as potential presidential candidates in 2020.
articles.abstract: “It’s not going to be just one woman running,” said Kirsten Gillibrand, one of three senators who positioned themselves this week as potential presidential candidates in 2020.
articles.lead_paragraph: GREENVILLE, S.C. — Three prominent female Democrats all but openly began running for president this week, taking their most active steps yet to challenge President Trump and claim leadership of a movement of moderate and liberal women that has come to define their party during the 2018 elections.
articles.byline: By Alexander Burns and Lisa Lerer

articles.headline: Wall Street Loves These Risky Loans. The Rest of Us Should Be Wary.
articles.snippet: The C.L.O., a cousin of the mortgage-related product that malfunctioned a decade ago, has become one of the hottest investments on Wall Street.
articles.abstract: The C.L.O., a cousin of the mortgage-related product that malfunctioned a decade ago, has become one of the hottest investments on Wall Street.
articles.lead_paragraph: A financial assembly line that went haywire a decade ago and contributed to an economic crisis is gearing up again on Wall Street.

articles.headline: Catholic Bishops Promising to Fix Sex Abuse Problem Face Cover-Up Accusations
articles.snippet: The church’s failure to police its own ranks has led some Catholics to call for a total housecleaning of all bishops who gave cover to abusive priests.
articles.abstract: The church’s failure to police its own ranks has led some Catholics to call for a total housecleaning of all bishops who gave cover to abusive priests.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Catholic bishops try to reassure the flock that the church is finally confronting the scourge of sexual abuse by priests, it has fallen to Cardinal Daniel N. DiNardo, the president of the American bishops conference, to lead the effort.
